sentences.english: Do you know how much you spend on clothes and groceries annually?
sentences.chinese: 你知道你每年要爲衣服和雜貨花費多少嗎？

sentences.english: The grocer studies to please his customers.
sentences.chinese: 雜貨商老闆考慮着要迎合顧客。

sentences.english: Do you want paper or plastic bags for your groceries?
sentences.chinese: 到他們當地的雜貨店時，用紙袋還是塑膠袋？

sentences.english: But we still can't strap on a jetpack and zoom off to Tesco for our groceries.
sentences.chinese: 只是，我們還不能綁着噴氣揹包去樂購買雜貨。

sentences.english: Even the boy bagging groceries seemed to sense it.
sentences.chinese: 就連裝雜貨的男孩好像都感覺到了。

sentences.english: There is a grocery store over the road maybe you can find the juice there.
sentences.chinese: 路對面有家雜貨鋪，也許你能在那裏買到果汁。

sentences.english: Most of the aromatherapy carrier oils you find in grocery stores are not cold-pressed .
sentences.chinese: 大部分的香薰油母你覺得不冷雜貨店喘不過氣來。

sentences.english: Even a simple pasta would work; buy dessert from the bakery in the grocery store.
sentences.chinese: 還可以從食品雜貨店的麪包房中買一些甜點。

sentences.english: The cook and the grocer haggled over the price of eggs.
sentences.chinese: 廚師和雜貨商爲蛋的價格討價還價。

sentences.english: My husband and I grocery shopped together for years.
sentences.chinese: 我丈夫和我一起買雜貨已經幾年了。

sentences.english: Pretty soon you won't have the burden of making eye contact at the grocery store.
sentences.chinese: 很快地你將不負有舉證責任死死地盯着雜貨店。

sentences.english: In Europe the most pilfered grocery item is luxury cooked meat.
sentences.chinese: 在歐洲，最經常被偷的雜貨店商品是奢侈的熟肉製品。

sentences.english: The cook and the grocer haggled over the price of eggs.
sentences.chinese: 廚師和雜貨商爲蛋價計較個沒完。

sentences.english: I had a part-time job somewhere where I lived previously, at a grocery store.
sentences.chinese: 我之前在原來住的地方有份兼職工作，在一家雜貨店。

sentences.english: You can get the toasted coconut from Thai grocery store.
sentences.chinese: 烘椰肉可在泰國雜貨店購買。

definition: market/store/mall (usually specializing in a particular product category such as furniture)
to arrange/to set out/to decorate/to display/decorative items
